Reviews.Title: “Casa Banzo - well placed with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: seattlexs
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked separate rooms for 5 nights recently at Casa Banzo. The rooms were well appointed and the breakfasts more than fine. We felt we got a good value for our money. Some pluses: Anca - who seems to be the primary housekeeper, and jack of all trades... total sweetheart. Doesn't speak any English but sweet and helpful. Maria - who came and spoke English to us first day, oriented us to our rooms. Breakfast: hot tea, hot milk, delish cornettos (croissant). Super comfy bed on 2nd floor. Great location. Minuses: first floor noise from construction all day Saturday. Sound radiated up to even upper floors. First floor bed not so comfy and shower sort of IKEA-ish. Overall, a good place to stay right in the Ghetto and very near Campo di Fiori. Be sure to try Filete di Bucala around the corner. Yum....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Area- Perfect place.”
Reviews.Author: Vered B
Reviews.Content: we have stay at Casa Benzo for 5 nights. The location Was perfect. a minute from Campo De Fiori, 5 minutes from Piazza Navona & Travestera. The room was Clean, Well decorated and hed "Homely" feel. The owners was sweet and kind, And give us the option to chack out laeter at the departure day. I would love to go back to Casa Benzo at my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place!”
Reviews.Author: Lilivonmarlene
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Casa Banzo. Location is excellent, close to Campo di Fiori and Largo Argentina (for buses and trams). Accomodation in nice appartement-likes with even a small kitchen, washing machine, haidrdryer, etc. The service is excellent. The girl at the reception very helpful and nice. Maybe the only thing is that breakfast was a bit scarce (limited to one small croissant per person and some biscottes with marmelade, coffee or tea and some juice. That´s it. For 5€ maybe they could add another croissant or a bigger one or "real" toasts, not the packed ones...). Anyway, this is just a thing that could be improved, but the rest was really very good!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful apartment in a great location”
Reviews.Author: business_traveller73
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at Casa Banzo perfect and I will certainly return when next in Rome. The location is ideal, close to Campo Dei Fiori, Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Trastevere. We stayed in the self contained apartment on the ground floor which was really homely, well decorated, clean and peaceful and quite. The building has a beautiful courtyard and it makes for a very restful, quiet place, right in the heart of the historic centre. The courtyard has a beautiful wisteria which I imagine in the spring would be spectacular. The owners were very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Charming budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: La_Butte
Reviews.Content: Me, my sister and cousin shared a triple room here for two nights in October. The room was very nicely decorated. I liked the location just a couple blocks from Campo d'Fiori. though it is a little tricky to find (I got the hang of it by the second day). Breakfast was adquate. The price was very good. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Inge P
Reviews.Content: The bed and breakfast had an absolutely wonderful location - if you wish to walk around Rome - and don't take cab or bus. Everything "sights" are in walking distance - max 30 min. The rooms were i good condition - but be aware - no cell phones or wireless internet is working inside the rooms. We were 6 persons travelling together - had 2 rooms and plenty of space. Very relaxing and no noice from the street ! Would recommend this to all my friends - going to ROME !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while studying at John Cabot University”
Reviews.Author: bkm093
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect - very close to both campuses and in central Rome. The hotel was beautiful. It is very, very safe. The surrounding area is generally busy with activity and the hotel is through large doors in an inside courtyard. My room had no windows to the outside so it felt completely safe. Most of the time I was alone but twice I shared my room comfortably with a visitor from home. The room was extremely clean, adequate in size and the decor was fine. There was a small table for studying and/or eating. The staff was super nice. They helped me with many different things. The rate was good. They offered a discount because of my long stay. (It is not as cheap as the JCU dorms but I had none of the problems that my classmates had to deal with.) This is NOT a hotel for partying. It is peaceful with permanent residents in much of the building. It is hard to find so go prepared with directions and maps. The owners prefer that you try not to use the AC at night. They gave me a fan so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, very comfortable room, nice owners”
Reviews.Author: piersmarson
Reviews.Content: There are some very mixed reviews of Casa Banzo on trip advisor, so we weren't sure what to expect. We chose it because they were very efficient and pleasant to deal with and the place is very well located for those wanting to walk around the sites. The room was comfortable with a good bed which was made afresh every day. There was also aircon and fans which is essential in the hotter weather. The small bathroom with shower, loo, sink was very adequate and the whole room/wc was nicely decorated so no complaints there. Rome is very expensive to 100+ euros a night was very good value and the breakfast was spot on, with fresh coffee, bread, jams pastries etc. The owners were very friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed being able to walk out of the B&B and through the shops in the lovely rome back alleys. There is a daily market just a short walk away where we picked up fresh fruit for our outings and there are plenty of bars, restaurants near by. There river is very close and we walked to the Teatro Marcello for an outdoor concert in the grounds of this mini coloseum like building. The vatican is also fairly close by via a 15 minute along the riverside and even the Forums and coloseum isn't far. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay here. If you don't expect too much you will be pleasantly suprised. If you want luxury we looked at a room in the hotel de russie and they quoted me 1700 euros, so save your money and get good value accomodation, and spend what you save on great dining and expensive attractions. Note. If you go to the vatican don't go for the guided tour. It's a con quite frankly. We waited for 30 mins while they got enough people together, they then lead us to a cash machine outside the vatican so everyone got money out, then on to their tiny office to pay and then finally when we got in there was no queue anyway! The tour guide then rushed off so fast we just left them to enjoy the many artworks, rooms and the Sistine chapel in our own time!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation great location”
Reviews.Author: Pamster81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Very pretty courtyard location, very basic room, next to the cleaning cupboard and reception which was not ideal when the staff start cleaning at 7am and making a lot of noise. Other rooms we peered in briefly looked better.Thin walls so you can hear all your neighbours. Hard beds, linen wasn't changed but we were only there one night. Good shower, TV (only one channel available), kettle but no teabags, no iron. Quiet location in general, impossible to find from a map on Google so get a decent one. Only met one member of staff, pleasant enough but constantly asked when we planned to pay for the room (surely at the end of the stay?). Paid in cash as that's their preference, yet they had no change. Location is amazing for Campo Di Fiori market, Trevi Fountain, Palazzo Farnese, Piazza Venezia, Circo Massimo, and also the Colliseum not a long walk at all. Lovely river a short walk away. So all in all, if you're planning to be out and about a lot (why would you stay in your room!), great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LynnBG
Reviews.Content: Casa Banzo was perfect for our stay in Rome. We were in rome for 3 days kicking off our two week Italian vacation. It is in a very vibrant part of town, Campo de Fiori, with good shopping (mostly fashion), cafes and restaurnats. Everything was in walking distance: 10 min to Piazza Novona, 10 min to Pantheon, 30 mins to Villa Borgeses, 40 mins to the Vatican. We only took transit to get to the casa from the train station in Trastevere (there is a train that goes there pretty much directly from the airport, once you get off the train you get on local Rome transit - a tram that takes you accross the Tiber pretty much right to the hotel. I would agree with others who said, the Casa is tucked away - it is behind a mainly pedestrian street witha ll the shops and cafes. This it close to everything, but very quiet at night. The windows face into the centre of the lovely enclosed courtyard, so you will sleep well. There is no outdoor sign, so you must simply use the street address - google it and print a map beforehand. Anna, who was working there during our stay is a lovely girl, and very helpful. She does not speak much english, but is so eagar to please, it did not matter. The owner/host did speak english very well, but we did not see her as often. Rooms are graceful ,decorated with style, and ours had an exposed brick arch which showed how historic the building was. The room has everything you need: wifi, a small fridge, cups, etc. plus a little table to have a snack or nightcap at. It is near the Campo de Fiori: a wonderful, lively market square-good people watching- with many shops and cafes. We first heard of this b&b in Frommers. The breakfast is not included in the room rate, and I didn't particularly like the breakfast, but there was a cafe a few steps away for hte same price you had wonderful cafe late, croisant, and fresh OJ. It is helpful for most b&b owners in Italy if you pay cash. The credit card fees for small business owners are very high. We reserved the room with a credit card, and then paid cash at the end of our stay. It was EURO130 per night in Oct 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and friendly, this B&B is in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: EricaMaine
Reviews.Content: The Casa is tucked away, with no outdoor sign, so you must simply use the street address. Our host and hostess helped with suggestions and directions to restaurants and various sights after being sure we were settled and comfortable. Rooms are graceful ,decorated with style, and have everything you need. It is near a wonderful, lively market square-good people watching- with many shops and cafes. It's a short walk to the Vatican, the Pantheon and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: megt4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon after seeing recommendation in Frommer's. We were very pleased with our stay. The small apartment we had was charming and very comfortable, and it was in a building with a very attractive courtyard. The location was great, it was very close to Campo di' Fiori and Piazza Navona, and in a neighborhood with many excellent cafes and good shopping. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We did end up paying in cash, just something to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “dishonest”
Reviews.Author: Italia222
Reviews.Content: Reservations handled very poorly. Had to cancel due to illness, gave two months notice. Was assured there would be no charge. One night was charged to my account anyway. Have called for weeks; various staff members, including the hotel owner, blame each other for the mistake, promise to take care of it and never do. I have never written a review before, but it is important that people do not patronize a hotel with dishonest management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: nickels138
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Close to a lot of attractions. The place was very difficult to find and no one answered the buzzer when we got there so we were sitting outside until we ran into the person running the hotel. They requested cash which was strange because I don't make a habit of carrying 600 Euro on me. They eventually took my credit card. The room was small and kind of dingy. There's 8 other rooms and I don't know what the others looked like but ours was dark and not very cozy but we didn't plan on spending time in there anyway. At least it was clean. We only saw one person the 3 days we were there and she was not very friendly. She scolded us and the other guests for showing up for breakfast at 9:25 when the service stopped at 9:30 and dining area closed at 10. She gave us a bad feeling about the bed and breakfast as a whole. BOTTOM LINE: The location was good but you can probably find a nicer hotel for the money and definitely friendlier service.

Reviews.Title: “Ants all over the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: palazzobv
Reviews.Content: Casa Banzo was a great disappointment. We had seen a recommendation for it in the Guardian UK. Towels (if you can call them such; flimsy dishtowels is more like it) were laundered every two days; the bathroom was covered in ants, and on the last night, we were told that we'd have to leave the hotel because there was a problem with overbooking, but that they'd assist us in moving somewhere else. We walked around the neighborhood by ourselves and found a place with a comparable room for E60 less. Then the staff at Casa Banzo took us to the very same place that we'd found on our own, and told us that the rate there would be the same E140 that Casa Banzo had been charging. Needless to say, we felt swindled. On the upside, the location is good. However, overall, a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Italian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JE1205
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Casa Banzo for three nights while in Rome. This is the place to stay if you want a real experience... it's a cute little hotel/bed and breakfast in the center of Trastevere. It can be a bit difficult to find if you don't know your way around the area, but it is VERY close to Campo di Fiori and all the main attractions of central Rome and public transportation (all are in Largo d'Argentina, just a few "blocks" away). This hotel doesn't have an elevator so be prepared to carry your bags up the flights of stairs, and there is a heavy iron gate that you have to open to access some of the rooms... so if you are in need of assistance or convenience this is not the place to stay. We didn't have a chance to eat breakfast, but we heard it was good. The room was pretty clean. It lacks the amenities of the bigger hotels, but for the experience of staying in such a lovely building it is a fair trade.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, small, not sophisticated, but with an inexpensive charm”
Reviews.Author: jvenj
Reviews.Content: This bed and breakfast is recommended by some very prestigious sites, but mainly I think that is because it sits in a great old building very close to Campo dei Fiori and the staff at the inn are so very, very helpful. The rooms themsevles are very plain and there are no extra amentities. Security is dicey as some of the gates open easily without a key. The staff watches your use of the air conditioning and requires it off by 8:30 at night which can be very frustrating in the summer. But, the staff is also very helpful and accomodating, and they serve a lovely breakfast every morning in a beautiful high ceiling room. We stayed in two rooms right next to each other, my wife and I in one, our three teenagers in the other - worked out great, I thought, but definitely on the inexpensive, budget side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Digillusioned
Reviews.Content: Casa Banzo was in the perfect location -- no more than 30 minutes from any point of interest, and located right in the center of all the action. Two minute walk to the center of Campo de' Fiori, five minutes to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon, twenty to thirty minutes to the Vatican and Colosseum... all by foot, mind you. And being located right off the main road (Corso Vittorio Emanuele II), you could easily find a bus to wherever you needed to go. While the neighborhood could have a tendency of being loud, this B&B is tucked away into a nice, quiet courtyard, drowning out most of the noise found just a couple of steps away. Specifically, we stayed in the Romantico B&B room, easily able to sleep 4 people. There was a nice king-sized bed upstairs, a sleeper couch downstairs, another single bed upstairs, a nice sized bathroom (and if you've stayed anywhere in Europe, you'll realize what a luxury this is!), and a small kitchen. It was very clean, and the house-cleaning service was fantastic (we had fresh flowers in our vase every day!). The proprietors were very friendly and very helpful. For the location and the price of the apartment (split amongst 4 people), it was truly a bargain. Also, if you're traveling as a group of 4, ask them about their taxi service to and from the airport. The price you'll pay between getting from Fiumicino airport to Termini, and then the bus to Casa Banzo, is almost as much as their taxi driver charges for the 4 of you combined. I think it came out to an extra Euro for each of us -- well worth avoiding the hassle of trekking through Rome with your luggage, especially on the bus (the #64 to boot, a pick-pocket's haven!). The only complaint I could muster up would be with the construction that was going on right next to us. The B&B is growing, and they're converting some of the garages next to us into another apartment. Honestly though, this never bothered us. By the time they started working, we were already awake or out exploring. By the time we got back home, the work was done for the day. It might be a problem if you stopped back for a nap during the day, but ear plugs will solve the problem. Ultimately, the construction will end, and this isn't something you'll likely have to worry about. Overall, I can easily recommend Casa Banzo's Romantico apartment to anyone who wants to take advantage of all Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Casa Banzo!”
Reviews.Author: J_J_traveller
Reviews.Content: First placed we stayed in Italy and the best. It is a B&B, not a hotel. People should know that going in and not right bad reviews because they book one thing and expect another. Location is outstanding, rooms are small but comfortable, breakfast was a nice way to start the day. When we go back to Rome, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “European B&B - NOT a hotel”
Reviews.Author: schmitzkids
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 children (all btwn 5-9yrs), and I stayed in the 2-story "family room" for 4 nts in June. While my husband and I always stay in upscale btq hotels by choice, we needed a more reasonably-priced, large room for our family of 5. We chose Casa Banzo based on a "posh B&B" review by a reputable travel magazine. It was more rough, than posh, however, the staff (not owner), consisting of 2 women, were so gracious and hospitable, especially to my children, that they more than made up for some of the property's shortcomings. My youngest daughter still tallks about how much she loves Anka, one of the housekeepers. Both women did everything in their power to accommodate us. A few things to note: 1. Low water pressure and unstable hot water levels in the tub (no curtain, but w/handheld shower head). 2. Close the window shutters and turn on the A/C to help muffle the LOUD street noise at night. 3. This is a beautiful property, but it's old and not updated. On the plus side: 1. Fantastic location close to Campo di Fiori and all ancient Roman sites. 2. For 5 Euros/day, the A/C works VERY WELL and is necessary in the hot summer months. 3. Clean and wonderfully scented, ironed linens & towels. 4. Good value includes breakfast in such a pricey city. Go w/the knowledge that you are staying in someone's home in Italy. This is NOT a hotel. This is an European B&B, not an American one!

Reviews.Title: “Not my casa!”
Reviews.Author: feedbackid
Reviews.Content: I booked this B&B based on a favorable recommendation in Frommers. Unfortunately, the experience from booking to checkout was not user friendly and, frankly, we found the owner and staff to be the least friendly of any place we stayed during our 5-week tour. The owner requires a check (no credit cards) to reserve the room. The B&B was difficult to find for our cab driver as it is located on the second floor of an office building, in a not so nice square in the Campo di Fiore area. We were greeted by a disinterested, Italian-speaking housekeeper (and young children) who was covering for the unavailable owner. After the first night the remote control that operates the air conditioner was removed and were told that A/C is extra. Fortunately, I had a copy of the email making it clear that it was included in the price. Next we were falsely accused of cleaning our shoes with the towels - apparently a common problem for them because there was a sign in the room asking that you not use the towels to clean your shoes. Finally, at checkout, we learned that they they did not cash the deposit check I had mailed, and required that I pay the full amount in cash. In summary, this Casa is not my kind of casa!

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Banzo
HotelInfo.Address: 30 Piazza Monte di Pieta, 00186 Rome, Italy
